contentrichtext.text: [[File:Paul Cérésole.jpg|thumb|Paul Cérésole]] '''Paul Cérésole''' (16 November 1832, [[Friedrichsdorf]], [[Hesse-Homburg]] – 7 January 1905) was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician, [[List of judges of the Federal Supreme Court of Switzerland|judge of the Supreme Court]] (1867-1870) and [[member of the Swiss Federal Council]] (1870-1875). He was elected to the [[Federal Council of Switzerland]] on 1 February 1870, and handed over office on 31 December 1875. He was affiliated with the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland]]. While in office he held the following [[Ministry (government department)|departments]]: *[[Department of Finance (Switzerland)|Department of Finance]] (1870 - 1871) *[[Military Department (Switzerland)|Military Department]] (1872) *[[Political Department]] as [[President of the Confederation (Switzerland)|President of the Confederation]] (1873) *[[Department of Justice and Police]] (1874 - 1875) His son [[Pierre Ceresole|Pierre]] was a noted pacifist. Cérésole died 1905 in Lausanne.
